website_summaries.verdict: Compatible with a wide range of smart home systems, this starter kit has everything needed to intuitively control your lighting from anywhere.
pros: This smart switch is very responsive and easy to use
Can be used with iOS and Siri for easy light control
No neutral wire required for installation
Comes with remotes that boast a long battery life
Switch works well with LED lighting
cons: Wall switch does not have a memory button

customer_reviews.title: I love this product
customer_reviews.text: With a house full of people little items like this go a long way. From security lighting to timers set to shut off lights to save $$. Easy installation (assuming you have installed a light switch before) and programming is a breeze. I did have to look online on how to get it to work with Alexa, however, that was not hard and my total set-up time with everything per switch was about 10 minutes. Thank you!
customer_reviews.author: IceMan

customer_reviews.title: Buzz saw
customer_reviews.text: Do not buy this kit or switch if you have a semi-modern house with a white neutral wire. Get the Lutron PD-5NE (ELV+ Dimmer) instead. This piece of crap buzzes constantly. I have no idea why Lutron hides the other dimmer and markets this crap. AVOID AVOID AVOID.
customer_reviews.author: Nick M.

customer_reviews.title: All around great: great app, great customer service
customer_reviews.text: This is awesome! I have wanted to install a “smart light switch” in my house for years. But my house is old and the wiring is old, as well. So when I found this, I was really excited. I had a small hiccup when I was doing the installation and the customer service was awesome. The app is easy to use, the remote is a great feature. It works great with Alexa and I feel like I have a lot of control with the dimming. I bought some great led light bulbs on here that have worked great. Don’t hesitate, this is great!
customer_reviews.author: Kristin Tosello

customer_reviews.title: Plan plan plan then it’ll work great.
customer_reviews.text: Works really well if you have a conveniently central location in your house to place the hub. It does required a wired Ethernet connection so that’s another aspect. You can extend its range via one additional smart caseta plug, but that’s it. Outside of that, it works beautifully with all devices such Siri (HomeKit) and Alexa (Amazon). My hub works well and covers my entire 5k sq ft. It’s somewhat rectangular in shape so placing it in first floor middle of house worked best. Basement, 1st floor and 2nd floor.
customer_reviews.author: Zsoldier

customer_reviews.title: Works flawlessly!!  My wife roller her eyes when I told her about them, but now she couldn't live without them!  Convenience!!!!
customer_reviews.text: I finally pulled the trigger and am so glad I did. This is amazing!!! I have a large house with an open concept living area that has way too many light switches (some of which are in awkward locations). With this, I can simply say "Alexa, turn on all lights" and no more walking around hunting for switches. Also, the included PICO remote is great. I mounted them to more convenient locations, where the builder should have installed the original light switch. No wires required for the PICO and the battery boasts a 10-year life. I will be buying more of these!
customer_reviews.author: Jeff O.

customer_reviews.title: I love these switches I already had one before buying this ...
customer_reviews.text: I love these switches I already had one before buying this kit so I was already a fan, now I have the smart bridge(My laziness at its best), I recently purchase the Amazon Echo and then the Echo Dot and decide it was time to get the Lutron bridge they work perfect together. Both the Echo's turns the lights in my Theater Room and kitchen on and off or dims them without missing a beat. Well except when I have to reconnect the Echo to the Wi-Fi its already connected to but that's another story for another time. The dimmers and the bridge are Great I've had no issues with either.
customer_reviews.author: Christopher Cook

customer_reviews.title: Works on older homes
customer_reviews.text: Bought this because my switches aren't wired with a neutral (old construction). It works great with those – the switch, remote, and app all work well. I'm glad that I can control my lights from a phone, without rewiring my house. My only complaint is the responsiveness. Sometimes, when turning it on, it flashes at a high brightness momentarily, and then takes a second or two to actually turn on to the brightness set. I imagine this is a limitation of the system.
customer_reviews.author: Joshua

customer_reviews.title: Awesome for home automation
customer_reviews.text: This is simply amazing. Super easy to install, even for three-way switches. I really like that there are mechanical switches in case there are ever issues with wifi. Replacing the wall switch works much better for me than replacing each light bulb with a smart bulb (far cheaper and I do not have to worry about someone accidentally turning off the wall switch--a common issue with smart bulbs). The directions are well written for three-way switch installs and clearly state the amp rating. Simply a perfect system, especially with an echo dot for voice control
customer_reviews.author: Josh

customer_reviews.title: Complete package for Alexa integration. Great dimmer, easy to instal and includes the hub
customer_reviews.text: This is identical to the switch plus remote package that has good reviews and that I also like. This one comes with the hub needed to make Alexa integration work. 5 starts works perfectly. The dimming range adjustment plus no neutral needed plus Alexa plus optional remotes? This is the best dimmer switch. It’s also pricy but over time I plan to replace all my dimmers with this one
customer_reviews.author: S. Savara

customer_reviews.title: Works, but misleading on how many bulb brands it works with.
customer_reviews.text: Is very nice, but they need to be much clearer on what bulbs to use. While they may have tested it with a thousand+ light bulbs, that doesn't mean it works with them. Their web page shows the much fewer number of bulbs it works with, and not those it doesn't. Sunco LEDs are one it only partially works with. It does raise and lower them, but they always stay slightly lit. Or at least mine do. Also wish they'd give written instructions on setting them up instead of making you find a video on their web page which moves too fast to complete the setup as it plays.
customer_reviews.author: MWR

customer_reviews.title: Exactly what I needed
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this switch/Hub for my TV/Projector room, where is essential. Excellent product, quality manufacturing, easy instructions, no neutral wire required, nice packaging, easy to use, and integrates will with other Bluetooth Hubs. I can't think of anything negative to say. Also, even though the remote is IR (Line of Sight), it still works one room away. Also, the phone app with "Slider" Dimmer control is perfect. Highly Recommended.
customer_reviews.author: Bill

customer_reviews.title: GREAT Google Assistant Integration
customer_reviews.text: I have lights in the house that can't be simply replaced with smart bulbs. I simply replaced the standard light switch with the Caseta switch and Hub. Adding additional switches was just as easy. All in all, the value of the switch to control multiple lights is great. Integrates well with Google Assistant, which is my smart home assistant of choice.
customer_reviews.author: Glenn Rossney

customer_reviews.title: 100% reliable! A "hub" system is the way to go! After learning the hard way, you don't want to hook each devise to your home net
customer_reviews.text: After trying 3 other systems and ending up with about 14 WEMO devices (very high maintenance) I broke down for a "Hub" system and will never look back. Reason, Just one piece of hardware to manage!!!! All the switches are taken care of by the "hub" This is huge!!! And the other systems tend to "loose connection" on a regular basis. I have Lutron in both my houses now (and the app is switchable, unlike WEMO) I love this system!!!!
customer_reviews.author: E. Kent

customer_reviews.title: Great system - LED compatibility poor.
customer_reviews.text: I am finding this dimmer not very capable with LED bulbs. When the lights are turned 'off' at the switch they act like a slow speed strobe light which is not viable (though would be handy for a disco party). The LED bulbs are 'dimmable' and when I replaced all the bulbs with LED bulbs leaving one incandescent it works fine, dimming all the bulbs and turning them off when the switch is 'off'. I absolutely love the Caseta system and give that a 5 star rating, but the LED capability of this dimmer I give a 1 Star rating. The actual rating is the average of these 2 ratings.
customer_reviews.author: Geordie

customer_reviews.title: FLASHING LIGHTS if turn on from ECHO - ok from wall switch.  LUTRON NO HELP YET!
customer_reviews.text: Waiting for Lutron to reply to my query. Dimmer works, remote works, bridge works. but when I turn my lights on and off from ALEXA (through the Lutron bridge) the all (4 LED spotlights) - BLINK SLOWLY..... No problems when I control from the dimmer or the PICO remote.... Hope I get a quick solution and can reset my rating on this! Continuing conversations. Don't want to pay electrician to pull this back out as that would cost as much as the product did!
customer_reviews.author: Daniel L. Laser

customer_reviews.title: the best smart switches
customer_reviews.text: Lutron Caseta is the best brand for smart switches. They work flawlessly, look good, and are super easy to set up. They are also the most compatible smart switch working with all the big players which should make it future proof. I use mine with homekit, alexa, and even alarm.com. I used to use zwave and i basically gave up trying to wire the 4 way switch in my upstairs hallway until i got these. I got it done in like 15 minutes and works perfect.
customer_reviews.author: Curt

customer_reviews.title: Lutron break the setup, then no support
customer_reviews.text: Initially the dimmers that I purchased worked through the standard hub and my Home Assistant setup, all was well. Then some one (Lutron) made changes to the hub firmware and broke the system. None can be controlled via the home automation system. It appears that the only way to restore it is to purchase the Pro Hub for another $150 and hope that Lutron doesn't break that also. My advice if you have a choice buy another brand. Lutron has not answered any of my questions.
customer_reviews.author: Charles

customer_reviews.title: Intermittent annoying flashes
customer_reviews.text: Frustrating because it misbehaves just frequently enough to be annoying. I have it paired to Alexa, and about 10-15% of the time the light flashes on then off, pauses a second then comes on and stays on. I don't know if it has the same behavior with the phone app, because the reason I got it was to pair with Alexa. It's not Alexa because all my other switches behave properly.
customer_reviews.author: Bob Guzik

customer_reviews.title: Have to use scissors to open Installation - super easy. Anybody could do it
customer_reviews.text: Packaging - the plastic is a pain. Have to use scissors to open Installation - super easy. Anybody could do it. I love that the size is the same as existing light switches so it makes it super easy to replace it with the lutron switch. Took about 5 min to install. Lutron app is easy to use and easily connects with HomeKit. I do wish when setting schedules you didn’t have to set a separate schedule to turn off and on the light. It’s cumbersome and annoying to have to do it this way.
customer_reviews.author: Lisa Desai

customer_reviews.title: Works with Apple Home
customer_reviews.text: I have started replacing regular On/Off switches with these connected wireless switches. They are quite capable of taking the LED lamps to a near candle light light brightness to 100%. Love using the remote. I have mine connected to the hub that came in this kit. I chuck/throw/trash the stupid wire nuts that come with the product (like EVERY other product sold in the US) and Levernut. I like the stranded wires coming out of the switch, making it easy to manipulate, and squeeze into the wall.
customer_reviews.author: G. Adibhatla

customer_reviews.title: Awesome technology that works easily!
customer_reviews.text: awesome technology designed to work! Unlike a competitive brand I tried first this installed perfectly on the first try. I bought three of them and tied them into my echo dot... and the coolest thing is that the app for your phone allows for geofencing so the lights can go on after dark when you come withing 1000 feet of the house. Perfect when you are coming home to an empty and otherwise dark house. If you are shopping for a wifi dimmer you can stop now and buy these.
customer_reviews.author: Mark B

customer_reviews.title: Easy intergration
customer_reviews.text: Previously had a WINK system and decided not to pay the monthly fee when they converted from Fee to Fee. Once I understood that I had to reset my existing Caseta switches it was easy to pair them to the hub. Also, integrating the switches to ALEXA was a breeze.
customer_reviews.author: WTJohn

customer_reviews.title: Works well, allows control via phone or physical; widget for on/off and app for dimming control.
customer_reviews.text: Wish the system was a bit cheaper, but it is good. works well. I can control the lights manually or via phone. Had to convert 3 way switches to one dimmer, one remote, so that was a bit of a pain; but the functionality is good. Did it all myself - easy if u have basic knowledge of electrical and technology. The bridge requires a WIRED connection, then it connects to all your dimmers/switches; so make sure u have a wired connection to your network.
customer_reviews.author: Grzegorz Tokarski

customer_reviews.title: Ethernet cable connection required. Disable mobile VPN for setup.
customer_reviews.text: The general functionality is covered in many other reviews. One thing that wasn't clear to me (mainly because of assumptions) is that the bridge must always be connected via Ethernet cable... so the switches it controls are wireless, but the hub isn't. Secondly, I was having an issue during setup using my mobile phone, after the hub updated software my phone could not establish a connection with the hub. Ultimately I figured out the the VPN software on my phone was preventing the connection, once I allowed the Lutron app as an exception everything was fine.
customer_reviews.author: Todd Becker

customer_reviews.title: Great Product. Horrible Experience.
customer_reviews.text: Lutron’s products overall, and Caseta especially, are great products. They work great and solve many problems, as well as provide functionality beyond most comparable products. This experience however was not great. I ordered for a planned installation this week. Item came in an envelope without sufficient packaging. The item was sold as new. The item was obviously used and not reconditioned. The item was not repackaged properly. The dimmer and plate were scratched and sticky. I didn’t even test for functionality. The physical condition of the product alone rendered it useless to me.
customer_reviews.author: Bobby

customer_reviews.title: Works great
customer_reviews.text: The Lutron light controllers seem to be bullet proof. Have several and they always connect to the hub and work with the ios App with no problems. Linking with Alexa and Google Home works great though both occasionally "forget" that they are linked to the Lutron App. Fortunately they usually begin working again on their own. Probably indicates a problem on the server side not Lutron's fault.
customer_reviews.author: D. Bell

customer_reviews.title: Snap to install; no neutral needed
customer_reviews.text: House built in 1908, so I don’t feel like tearing the walls apart just to replace some wall switches with “smart” ones that require neutral wires. This went in in no time, and worked tight away. Plays nicely with both Alexa and Apple HomeKit. (The latter is most useful for turning the switches into triggers.) Great product; planning on buying more Lutron switches to expand the system!
customer_reviews.author: DAK

customer_reviews.title: Pico remotes are great with the switch.
customer_reviews.text: I just wrote a review for just the switch alone. Works great. Installation when replacing two switches was not as simple as I expected. The big plus about this combination is that you can install as many switches for to operate this one circuit as you want. You can also use the pico to control a group of lights. It can be installed anywhere on any surface or used as a standalone remote in their holder or just laying on a table. These work with their own hub and app or with the Harmony Hub or a Wink hub. Each has its own advantage. It will be easier to set up with the Lutron hub.
customer_reviews.author: btbuz

customer_reviews.title: - Works great paired with both Siri and Alexa
customer_reviews.text: I have been using a Lutron Caseta switch for about a year now. So far: Pros: - Works great paired with both Siri and Alexa. - Looks great. The modern faceplate is a big plus. Cons: - The bridge has to be wired to the network using an ethernet cable. There is no option to use 802.11. - Lutron doesn't currently offer a three-way compatible Caseta switch. The pico remote can be wall mounted with an additional kit to get this functionality but it would be great if there was a companion dimmer like the Maestro line.
customer_reviews.author: Nathan Hjelm

customer_reviews.title: Works great for just setting the lights high enough to eat ...
customer_reviews.text: Have this set up in my dining room chandelier. Works great for just setting the lights high enough to eat and also set the mood. I plan on getting several more of these for various other places in my house. I currently have this set up with my Amazon Echo and it works flawlessly. In the over two months I have had it, I have not had a single issue. The included pico remote works great to put on the coffee table so those that o not like using Alexa or feel more comfortable with the remote can turn lights off and on from afar.
customer_reviews.author: J.W.

customer_reviews.title: Easy set up, great functionality, no neutral wire needed
customer_reviews.text: Very easy install. A lot of reviewers are remarking about the clunkiness and lack of aesthetic design... frankly, I don’t find the panel to be too hard on the eyes OR hard to navigate. My Luddite mother in law was able to intuitively operate it from day one! The hub is fairly small, the app is streamlined... overall, very pleased with the purchase and set up. Thrilled that the switch doesn’t require a neutral wire. No brainer for older houses being converted to smart homes!
customer_reviews.author: aeniman

customer_reviews.title: Great starter pack
customer_reviews.text: Great starter pack, I wish it was a little cheaper but none of the cheap options are very good. The quality is really good. I was able to install the dimmer in about 15 minutes, it was very easy. The hub was easy to set up, at least I found it easy. It's small enough that it wasn't a problem finding a place to put it close to the router. The app is nice, though I couldn't get the widgets to work.
customer_reviews.author: Helpful Mama & Papa

customer_reviews.title: Great for houses that dont have nuetral wires
customer_reviews.text: I love the look and feel of these smart switched over the others ones ive tried. My house does not have a nuetral so it is awesome that this switch does not require that. I love the pico remote. So handy to have it. I mount them like a 3 way switch this way. Great product and works perfect. I have many of them in my house. Ive had them for almost 9 months now. Not one problem.
customer_reviews.author: giovanna free

customer_reviews.title: Solid no muss no fuss makes my wife happy
customer_reviews.text: Works correctly all the time. Some of the other smart home devices that have their own WiFi config have been flakey. This is solid and works. My only complaint is it’s kind of pricey. Replacing each switch in the house is a significant cost, beyond this starter kit. But it does make wife happy that you never have restart or reset it, and you can control the light with Alexa or automation, AND the wall switch.
customer_reviews.author: Avid Reader

customer_reviews.title: Excellent!
customer_reviews.text: I use this with Siri and home-kit with iOS10. Lutron's app works great with Apple's home-kit and at the time of this review, all features, functions, and settings are working great. I have also purchased the dimmers for lamps and created a variety of scenes and automation. Lutron's Caseta products have changed my house and lighting has become really fun to show off. Thanks Lutron!
customer_reviews.author: bbqkimchi

customer_reviews.title: Best thing I've bought on Amazon so far!
customer_reviews.text: Best thing I've ever bought on Amazon! I researched them and this switch is the best with the most options. Simple to connect once the hub/bridge is connected to wifi. You will need the bridge for these switches to work but you can connect almost unlimited switches and plugs to the bridge. Very easy to setup and also can connect to the Amazon Echo. Going to get a few more for some of the other lights. It has a setable timer to come on and go off at a preset time or at dusk and dawn. Also has a random setting for vacation to make it look like someone is home.
customer_reviews.author: Ginny Mankins

customer_reviews.title: Absolute garbage, will never work with App unless
customer_reviews.text: I am in tech and not only is it hard to get it to connect, it is even harder when you change the network.. also need to be hardwired straight to the router and since we use mostly wifi, the routers genreally have one port which in my case i had for google router.. Lutron does not know how to recognize Google wifi even if you provide the IP.. better to get wifi enabled lights than this..
customer_reviews.author: Rajesh V.

customer_reviews.title: Poor instructions and remote doesn't work
customer_reviews.text: I cannot get the remote to work. I am sure I am doing something wrong. However, since there are absolutely no instructions, I have no way of knowing. I just do not trust companies that will not provide instructions. I will not buy their products again.
customer_reviews.author: P. V. Cleave

customer_reviews.title: Best smart switches
customer_reviews.text: I'm not a fan of having another hub, but nothing beats the Lutron Caseta line for smart switches and integrations. Tied into my Home Assistant install easily and migrated off Wink to the Lutron bridge for controls.
customer_reviews.author: Matt C

customer_reviews.title: Works with older wiring 3 instead of 4
customer_reviews.text: I have the Samsung smart home, but to make this work I had to order the casetta's own home solution and that with the Samsung's interface to ultimately make Samsung's home solution the only piece that controls the house light switches. I bought 2, probably will buy more...
customer_reviews.author: Dr. Shulapi

customer_reviews.title: Awesome Wifi controlled light switch, setup very simple
customer_reviews.text: Setup this switch as a test to see if I want to outfit my entire home with Lutron Caseta switches, and I was blown away! The setup was very simple. You do need to have basic electrical knowledge when installing (mainly turning off the power to the area of the home you are installing it) so you don't get electrocuted. Once the switch was installed, and the hub plugged in the setup was very simple and then paring with Apple HomeKit was a breeze! Being able to control lights from my phone and to setup different scenes and automations to run under different triggers is fantastic!
customer_reviews.author: Drew

customer_reviews.title: First electrical project and we’re all still alive!
customer_reviews.text: Needed a setup for a living room light fixture that would connect into an old 2 wire setup, but yet was Smartified and this did the trick. Good news, this Was my first official electrical project, including mounting and connecting this to the Edison light fixture to which this controls - and, didn’t burn the complex down or get jolted with electricity! Go team! Seriously though, it’s pretty simple and super effective. Thanks
customer_reviews.author: William Neater

customer_reviews.title: Smarter than me probably
customer_reviews.text: So far it’s everything as advertised. A note to people going the DIY route. Expect the unexpected when you remove your current light switches. I removed 2 switches and both were wired differently. I don’t know how to rewire one switch and the other I had to reuse it’s funky ground.
customer_reviews.author: RickyT

customer_reviews.title: Easy to install, mediocre Alexa integration
customer_reviews.text: Easy to install, good app, poor Alexa integration makes it difficult to use scenes and verbal commands. My wife claims I’m in an eternal power struggle with Alexa regarding the names of my lights. Regardless, all in all this is a reasonably cost effective way to bring existing lights into the smart home era.
customer_reviews.author: Adam from Brooklyn

customer_reviews.title: If you have a situation where a bridge needs replacing a new account may be required for new bridge.
customer_reviews.text: The bridge was dead on arrival. Lutron replaced the bridge after troubleshooting. Took two weeks to get replacement. Had a little trouble seting up new bridge to existing account. I got the bridge and switches to work "hooray". The system works well, I'm impressed with the bridge range.
customer_reviews.author: Tom

customer_reviews.title: Perfect addition to a non-smart home
customer_reviews.text: This product was great for my apartment. I don't have a lot of smart home devices so I was a little nervous with this. But the set up is really easy and it allows me to use my bulbs to their full capacity, not just on or off. I like that you can set your lights to come on and go off at scheduled times.
customer_reviews.author: ashley

customer_reviews.title: No easy to create an account
customer_reviews.text: Installation of the switch itself was easy. It does not dim the lights down as far as other dimmers. Setting up the hub was a pain! It first has to be hard wired into one's WiFi router (mine is on top a a bookcase an inch from the ceiling an not easily accessed). Creating an account with Lutron was ridiculous. Their password requirements are absolutely horrible and it does not really specify what it requires, just "try making your password more complicated" (or words to that effect). A second dimmer switch arrived without the mounting plate or the wire nuts/screws.
customer_reviews.author: Troy

customer_reviews.title: Lutron support is exceptional.  Groups don't always seem to work that well with Alexa, but works great otherwise.
customer_reviews.text: Great product except that groups don't seem to work all that well with it. I think this may largely be an Alexa issue. Higher price than some other smart lighting options and requires the bridge, but Lutron support is second to none and is worth paying for. Pairing pico remotes is extremely easy.
customer_reviews.author: Anonymous

customer_reviews.title: The smart lights with Alexa Voice command is revolutionary
customer_reviews.text: The smart lights with Alexa Voice command is revolutionary! Took some time setting up the bridge. My best advice is the following: 1. After connecting the bridge go into your wireless router settings to locate the IP address for the bridge. 2. Using the command prompt ping the IP address to insure it's responding. 3. Using the advance settings feature on the Lutron App, type in the IP address found in the router settings. Be patient and remember you are working with new technology.
customer_reviews.author: Jason Rivera

customer_reviews.title: Alexa and Lutron work well together
customer_reviews.text: I setup this product with the Amazon dot today. I had already installed two independent switches, as there was no way to get a run between them to make it a three way switch, and synced the two together making them work as a single switch. The product is a little pricey, but works exceptionally well. The lutron app was very easy to use and setup on minutes. I'm already lazy enough I don't want to flip a switch. Just ask Alexa to set the lights to 10%...
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: great value
customer_reviews.text: I needed the hub, but why not save some money and get the extra switch and remote. This is a great value. They just work first time and every time with my smartthings attached to google home.
customer_reviews.author: Zigma

customer_reviews.title: Best way to get started with a Smart Home
customer_reviews.text: To get started making your Smart Home you'll need Lutron's hub. This package is - by far - the cheapest way of obtaining that hub AND includes a switch and remote which you'd be buying anyway. I used this to start wiring my entire house to work with Apple HomeKit. $900 later and I'm 100% smart home and LOVE it. Favorite upgrade!
customer_reviews.author: AdventureMK

customer_reviews.title: Switches work great. Integration with SmartThings and Alexa through the hub ...
customer_reviews.text: Switches work great. Integration with SmartThings and Alexa through the hub works reliably and easy to set up. Only potential issue that I experienced was that the size of switch leaves very little room within the switch box for wiring, atleast in the switch boxes in my home. However, once installed, they have worked great. I will be purchasing additional switches to convert more switches to Caseta as we continue upgrading lights.
customer_reviews.author: R Roh

customer_reviews.title: So worth the money
customer_reviews.text: NO NEUTRAL WIRE!! It took all of 30 minutes from unpacking to complete install. The setup with the bridge took another 5 minutes and now I can control my 4 living room can lights with Alexa, on and off as well as intensity, very very satisfied
customer_reviews.author: nothingness

customer_reviews.title: Works with smart home devices. Love it
customer_reviews.text: This is a dimmer switch that could be used with a remote control and you can also hook it up to your smart home device. We bought it for my mother at all she has to do is say “hey Google turn off the lights“ and, the lights turn off. She could also do you have the lights by telling google to dim the lights. Works with other smart home devices as well.
customer_reviews.author: AlwaysTanna

customer_reviews.title: Works flawlessly, just expensive
customer_reviews.text: Love being able to control my lights anywhere with my iPhone. Easy to program to come on and dim when I want. Two criticisms, one it is expensive, and two I wish I could program a time based of off sunset or sunrise. I can program actions at sunrise or sunset, but I would love to have the lights come on say 30 minutes after sunset or go off 1 hour before sunrise.
customer_reviews.author: Hot Rod

customer_reviews.title: Very useful device
customer_reviews.text: The ease of installation was unexpected and the software was very impressive. It linked to Seri on my iPhone perfectly, at least from within my home network so I can turn on, off, and dim the light in question. I'm sure I'll install more of these in our house because they could act as a deterrent to would-be burglars. I don't yet know how many lights can be controlled by one bridge (an essential component connected to the router) and it will be a while before I find out because these things aren't cheap.
customer_reviews.author: timc

customer_reviews.title: tried different garbage, but Caseta WORKS every single time
customer_reviews.text: tried different garbage, but Caseta WORKS every single time, dont go for anything else, its worth every single penny, 2 years and not a single issue with any of the 12 I have installed in the house. The china made garbage quits in a few months.
customer_reviews.author: The Aazads

customer_reviews.title: Great!
customer_reviews.text: Works great. These wireless products can be confusing to set up but after a few you get the hang of it. Main thing when connecting this is to disable the 5.0 GHz on your router for it to work. Once you're connected, turn on back the 5.0 and you're back in business
customer_reviews.author: DS

product_meta.title: Lutron P-BDG-PKG1W Caseta Wireless Dimmer Kit with Smart Bridge, White
product_meta.description: Adjusting lights and shades from a smart phone has never been easier, more reliable, or affordable. Experience the ultimate convenience with the Lutron Caseta Wireless dimmer, Pico remote control and Smart Bridge. The wireless dimmer gives you the ability to set the right light for any activity whether it's reading, watching TV, entertaining, or having a casual dinner. The dimmer works up to 600 watts of incandescent or halogen and 150 watts of dimmable LED or dimmable CFL. Control the lights from anywhere in the room by using the Pico remote control either in your hand, on a tabletop pedestal (sold separately) or by mounting the remote directly to the wall. You can even use the Pico remote to control the lights from your car as you arrive home. Use the Lutron Smart Bridge and App to control lights and shades from anywhere, schedule them to adjust automatically based on the time of day, or create your favorite scenes that adjust multiple lights and shades with the press of a button. This kit includes one wireless in-wall dimmer, one Pico remote control, one coordinating screwless wallplate and one Lutron Smart Bridge. Pico remote control takes (1) CR2032 battery, included in remote.
feature_bullets: Connects with more leading Smart Home brands (including Amazon Alexa, Apple HomeKit, the Google Assistant, Nest, Serena shades, and Sonos) than any other leading smart lighting control brand
Easy to set up and schedule lights so your family will always come back to a well-lit home
Lights can automatically adjust with changing seasons and Daylight Savings time
Smart Away feature turns lights on and off randomly when you are traveling
Use with voice assistant, Pico remote (included), or smartphone via the FREE Lutron iOS and Android
Dimmer switch installs in 3 steps in about 15 minutes and is an ideal solution, even for older homes, as it does not require a neutral wire
Dimmer switch controls up to 17 bulbs per circuit (based on 8.5W LED bulb, 60W incandescent bulb)
Tested and recommended for use with over 1,000 dimmable LEDs, incandescent and halogen bulbs (for recommended LED bulbs, please see "Technical Specification")
